main event: On September 3, 1950, three unidentified aerial objects were observed in Spokane, Washington.
interesting points: The objects appeared to be circular or cylindrical in shape and moved with smooth gliding motion., The witnesses described the objects as capable of abrupt changes in direction and speed., The objects emitted no sound during the observation., One object appeared to have a bluish-white light and left a fiery trail., Major Gardinier initially thought the objects were pieces of cardboard before realizing they were under powered control.
